_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary
Risk Management Plan for Natural Gasoline
ADM Corn Processing
Walhalla, ND

Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:
It is the policy of the Archer Daniels Midland Company (ADM) Corn Processing Facility, Walhalla, ND to implement the requirements of the Risk Management Program in accordance with the USEPA regulations under 40 CFR Part 68.  The objective is to prevent an explosion/fire or release of natural gasoline and to minimize the potential impact to ADMÂ¿s employees, the public and the environment.  This objective will be accomplished by utilizing good operating procedures, maintaining a preventative maintenance program, providing appropriate training to employees and coordinating response activities with local emergency responders.

Facility description and regulated substances handled:
ADM Corn Processing at Walhalla is located on 111 acres approximately 1.5 miles east of the city of Walhalla, ND.  The primary activity of the facility is processing corn to manufacture fuel ethanol and distillerÂ¿s grain.

In this Risk Management Plan (RMP), ADM has included a program for its denaturant used in the production of fuel ethanol.  The denaturant (natural gasoline) used at the facilities generally has a National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) flammability hazard rating of less than 4 and is exempt from the RMP according to 40 CFR 68.115(b)(2).  However, due to the potential variability in the make-up of this additive, it is possible that ADM will receive material that has a flammability rating of 4.  Therefore, ADM has the RMP for managing the denaturant as a precautionary measure.  The regulated substances found in natural gasoline are n-pentane & isopentane. 

The main components of the natural gasoline system are a truck unloading station, an unloading pump, two storage tanks, a transfer pump and associated valves and piping.  Natural gasoline is received by truck only.

General accidental release prevention program an

d chemical-specific prevention steps:
The general concepts in this facility's prevention program are operating procedures, safe work practices, personnel training, and maintenance and mechanical integrity programs.  Prevention steps specific to the natural gasoline system are operating procedures, alarm and interlock system to prevent overfilling the tanks, and periodic verification of the tank level indications and overfill protection system.

Five-year accident history:
The facility had no reportable accidents in the last five years.

The emergency response program:
Emergency response at this facility is coordinated with ADM personnel and the Pembina County Emergency Planning Committee so that in the event of an accident, immediate emergency response measures will be implemented.  The facility maintains a written Emergency Response Plan to deal with prevention of and response to accidental releases of hazardous materials.

Planned changes to improve safety:
ADM will continue to evaluate and implement changes when necessary to improve safety at the Walhalla facility.
